instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio? no chime
threads.message:
hey guys,

This one had no power/no boot. Upon closer inspection i found some corrosion under the grey spongey type sticker next to battery connector. Once i peeled it away i noticed some corrosion and tested components to find short on one of the caps. it was corrosponding to <SIGNAL>PP_AUDIO_CH</SIGNAL> and shorting to ground. I also lifted the <CHIP>U6400</CHIP> and reballed just incase  there was any crap under there. All is well boots but no chime. 

I notice now <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is measuring 3.50v??
What is the best way to proceed. Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio? no chime
threads.message:
Check if any traces to audio area is corroded.
There are some small coils placed on the power rails.
<CHIP>U6400</CHIP> is only for microphone.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio? no chime
threads.message:
Sound is back.
Thanks please close

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio? no chime
threads.message: When someone post how it solved a problem, could help in other repair of someone else...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio? no chime
threads.message: Not sure what it was my workmate washed in ultrasonic and pram few times and sound came back. not sure what was causing the issue.
